verse: Some time passed. One day, the word of the Eternal One came to Abram through a visionâ€”a kind of waking dream.
Immediately the word of the Eternal One came to him.
God took him outside to show him something.
Abram believed God and trusted in His promises, so God counted it to his favor as righteousness.
Abram brought God all of these animals and cut them in two, laying each half next to the other, making two rows. Only the birds were not cut in two.
And when any birds of prey swooped down on the carcasses, Abram swatted them away.
As the sun was setting in the west, Abram fell into a deep sleep. A terrifying darkness descended upon him.
When the sun had gone down and darkness had fallen, a smoking firepot and a flaming torch passed between the halves of the animal carcasses.
With this ritual and on this day, the Eternal One made a covenant with Abram.
